TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AIErrorCode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Possible error codes encoded in the AIError.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode AccessDenied = unsigned int32(4)

summary.para: The resource owner or authorization server denied the request.
In general on getting this type of error, the application can call the AuthorizeUser method.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode ApplicationNotAuthorized = unsigned int32(1)

Docs.summary: A valid refersh token was not found. The refresh token held by the SDK is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, does not have the required scopes, or was issued to an other client.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode DeviceError = unsigned int32(5)

Docs.summary: The SDK encountered a device error. Currently, the SDK only throws this error when it receives the some error from the keychain service.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode ErrorUserInterrupted = unsigned int32(3)

Docs.summary: The user cancelled the login page.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode InternalError = unsigned int32(9)

Docs.summary: An internal SDK error, can not be handled by the application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode InvalidInput = unsigned int32(6)

Docs.summary:
One of the API parameters is invalid. The request is missing a required parameter, includes an invalid parameter value, includes a parameter more than once, or is otherwise malformed.
Check your method parameters and try again. This error is expected from all APIs.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode NetworkError = unsigned int32(7)

Docs.summary: A network error occurred, possibly due to the user being offline. In general on getting this error the application can ask the user to check their network connections.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode NoError = unsigned int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode ServerError = unsigned int32(2)

Docs.summary: An error ocurred on the server. The server encountered an error while completing the request, or the SDK received an unknown response from the server. In general, when getting this error, the application can ask the user to retry the operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode UnauthorizedClient = unsigned int32(8)

Docs.summary: The client is not authorized to request an authorization. The application is not authorized to make this call. Make sure the registered Bundle identifier matches your application, and that you have a valid APIKey property in the application property list.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Amazon.Login.AIErrorCode UnknownError = unsigned int32(4294967295)
